title: Phil Spencer's guide to negotiating thousands of pounds off the price of your dream home
text:
Britain’s housing market remains sluggish, with prices rising at just 1.1pc, according to Halifax, the slowest rate for more than six years.

While this may be bad news for homeowners, prospective buyers are rubbing their hands in glee. Estate agents have warned sellers – particularly those in London and the South East – that they may have to accept offers far below asking price to secure a deal.

But even the most desperate seller won’t slash the price unless their arm is twisted, and knowing how to negotiate is key to getting them to acquiesce.
